PPMonth.title: The A-Team
PPMonth.notes:
[Dossiers](dossiers.pdf) are needed to solve main 4 puzzles - each team received one at event and needed to share.
Thanks to Wil Zambole of [Chicago Puzzled Pint](https://twitter.com/puzzpintchi) for writing all of this month's puzzles!

puzzle.title: Hire the A-Team
puzzle.hint: Each item shown is associated with a different country.
How can you connect each country to its item?
Does the phrase "English Bulldog" give you any ideas?
The phrases you make will form a chain. Keep track of the ordinal number of each country (first, second, etc.), then take that letter from the group.
The first letter to grab is H from the starting country, FRANCE.
First connection is FRENCH KISS.
Last connection is SWISS BANK.
The solution is HIDING.

puzzle.title: Hannibal
puzzle.hint: There are 11 groups of 4.
One in each group has been changed. Determine how it changed, and what it should be3.
There are hints on file cards for groupings if you can't find them.

puzzle.title: Face
puzzle.hint: Face is second in command.
Try reading downwards
Follow the instruction, then look again somewhere else.
The flowers are located on the file cards.

puzzle.title: BA Baracus
puzzle.hint: Each of those clue answer has something in common about them.
That connection has to do with the fact that his name is BA.
Each clue leads to a person with two initials.
Find those intitials in the grid, there is a letter in between each of them.

puzzle.title: Murdoch
puzzle.hint: You will need help to get the rest of the map.
Did you check the file cards?
Find the most direct route.
Try working backwards like a typical pencil maze would.

puzzle.title: Mission Accomplished! (meta puzzle)
puzzle.hint: The names on the bottom are in that order for a reason.
What did you hear?
After peforming the instruction, literally close the book.

puzzle.title: Fugitives (bonus puzzle)
puzzle.hint: Each word on the left matches with one on the right.
Find the missing word that would connect them
See the plan through the jail cell bars.
